intro: Amphiasma benguellense, commonly known as the Benguela sea hake, is a species of fish found in the coastal waters of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Merlucciidae and is characterized by its streamlined body and silver-scaled appearance. This fish is typically found in deeper waters and is an important commercial species in the region. It feeds primarily on smaller fish and invertebrates, playing a significant role in the marine ecosystem. Due to overfishing, its population has been declining, leading to conservation concerns.
